quote: All above is stone, all below is stone, but our minds?
The rot will take flesh and thought alike â€” but the mountain endures.
Flowing... flowing... From where? To where?
If I breathe, then I shall die.
The chasm cuts deeper than just East and West.
The Dorfs are enviable in their blissful simplicity.
Truth only exists with total knowledge. All else is speculation.
There is no wrong piece of data. Only data not yet given context.
When the Final Word is spoken, the mountain shall fall silent.
Now the Elders watch from silent vessels as the mountain forgets their names.
The Rotless City. Untouched by Death and equally by Life.
Under the mountain, night is eternal. We can but hold torches to delay it.
Your rotting corpse will survive longer than you.
I jump from the peak so that I may find my roots.
